name: Product 1 Modulo N
statement: Now you get Baby Ehab's first words: "Given an integer $$$n$$$, find the longest subsequence of $$$[1,2, \ldots, n-1]$$$ whose product is $$$1$$$ modulo $$$n$$$." Please solve the problem. A sequence $$$b$$$ is a subsequence of an array $$$a$$$ if $$$b$$$ can be obtained from $$$a$$$ by deleting some (possibly all) elements. The product of an empty subsequence is equal to $$$1$$$.
inputFormat: The only line contains the integer $$$n$$$ ($$$2 \le n \le 10^5$$$).
outputFormat: The first line should contain a single integer, the length of the longest subsequence. The second line should contain the elements of the subsequence, in increasing order . If there are multiple solutions, you can print any.
